text: I have NEVER played tennis before.
I have been very briefly introduced to the game (one or two times maximum), but I have extreme difficulty playing the game due to a lack of consistency in rallying and serving.
I lack control on my groundstrokes, resulting in inconsistent rallies. I often choose to hit forehands instead of backhands.
I can rally 10 balls in a row at a slow pace, especially on the forehand, with an arched trajectory over the net.
I am able to consistently rally 10 balls in a row on forehands and backhands at a moderate pace. I am somewhat able to maintain a rally when receiving high, short, or wide balls.

I can maintain a rally at moderate speeds and I can neutralize fast balls. I am able to move the opponent around the court or hit harder when receiving easier balls to gain a clear advantage. I can execute approach shots to the net with some consistency.

I can maintain a rally at a fast pace fairly consistently. I am able to develop points tactically with consistency by using a reliable combination of shots. I am still somewhat erratic when attempting a high-quality shot, when receiving very fast or wide balls, or when attempting passing shots.

I can use a variety of spins and tactics to win points. I am beginning to develop a dominant shot and/or good steadiness. I am a bit erratic when attempting a high-quality shot in two of the following situations: when receiving fast balls, wide balls, and in passing shot situations.

I am able to easily maintain a rally of 10 balls in a row on fast balls and go shot-for-shot tactically with the opponent. I have very steady strokes and/or a dominant shot. I am moderately successful  when attempting a high-quality shot when receiving fast or wide balls, and in passing shot situations.
I have an inconsistent return. I tend to position myself in a manner to protect my weaknesses.
I am somewhat consistent when returning towards the middle of the court.
I can control the direction of the ball when receiving a serve of moderate pace.
I can return moderate-to-fast paced serves or well-placed serves with defensive actions. When receiving an easy second serve, I can return with some pace or directional control.

On moderately paced first serves, I can construct the point through hitting a good shot or exploiting an opponent's weakness. I can defend fast-paced first serves. I occasionally struggle to return quality second serves.

When recieving fast first serves, I can defend serves consistently but I am somewhat inconsistent when attempting an aggressive return off a first serve. I am consitent returning second serves of any kind.

I can get the ball back in play off most types of serves. I can sometimes even succeed at sending an aggressive return off fast first serves using my dominant shot (forehand or backhand). I almost never miss returning a second serve, and I am often able to attack it and win the point.
I am reluctant to come to the net. I avoid my backhand volley and I am a bit lost at times as to what to do with the forehand volley.

I have become at ease at the net in practice for the most part but I am still uncomfortable in most game situations. I am usually able to put away easy forehand volleys at chest-to-shoulder height into a wide open court.

I am relatively consistent on the forehand volley with easy and sometimes medium difficulty balls, but I am still inconsistent on the backhand volley. Overall, I have difficulty with low and wide balls. I can smash easy lobs.

My volleys are consistent. I can direct forehand volleys; I can control the backhand volley but with little offense; I still have some difficulty with making tactically sound volley decisions. I can handle volleys and overheads that require moderate movement.
I am comfortable with following an approach shot to the net and volleying into tactically sound spots. I am able to put away easy and medium difficulty overheads.

When coming to the net after serving, I am consistently able to put the first volley in play; however, I am inconsistent when trying to volley powerful or angled returns. Close to the net, I can finish a point using various options including the drop volley, angle volley, punch volley.

I am comfortable at the net in any situation and make sound tactical decisions. I can hit the overhead effectively from almost any position. I can follow up a first serve to the net and make volleys from ankle-to-knee height consistently.
I have an incomplete service motion. My toss is inconsistent. Double faults are common for me unless serving underhand.
I am attempting a full service motion on the first serve. My first serve in inconsistent (less than 50% success). I use an incomplete motion to ensure a steady second serve.
I use a full motion on both first and second serves. I am able to achieve more than 50% success on the first serve. My second serve is quite a bit slower than my first serve.
I can vary the speed or direction of my first serve. I can direct my second serve to the opponent's weakness without double-faulting on a regular basis.

I can vary the speed and direction of the first serve and am starting to use spin tactically. I use spin (slice and kick) on my first and second serves. Kick serves are still somewhat difficult to accomplish consistently, however.

I have an aggressive first serve with power and spin, or it is otherwise very reliable. My second serve frequently hits the court with good depth and placement. I can serve and volley after my first serves, but experience some inconsistency when the opponent's return is of a higher quality. I've mostly mastered the kick serve.

My first serve can win points outright or force a weak return consistently, or it is extremely consistent with moderate pace and fantastic placement. My second serve prevents the opponent from attacking most of the time, and I very rarely double fault. I can serve and volley off first serves.
I am capable of competing and winning matches in Open level tournaments (5.0+).
I have extensive international level tournament experience at the entry professional level and above.
None of the above apply to me; ask me more questions.
